intro: Ampliglossum barbaceniae, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
